title: Headline in Lecker Special (Bakery), 2014
content:
Hello brilliant people!

Does anyone know what this font is called? It's used on some of the headlines in the bakery-special from Lecker this summer.

Thank you!

Font: 

 Reina 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110143/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lecker.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110143/http:/typophile.com/files/lecker.jpg) | 176 KB |
author: gish

comments.content:
It looks like **[Reina](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110143/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/argentina-lian-types/reina/)** by Maximiliano R. Sproviero [Lián Types, 2011]  
You should use stylistic alternates for /K & /G
